description.narrative: Using innovation to: support integration of the 2030 Agenda in development plans, budgets and financing frameworks; and strengthen UNDP effectiveness at the regional level and help countries deliver results on the 2030 Agenda.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of platforms on innovative solutions 2. Operational innovation centre established 3. Number of workshops on accelerating development 4. Innovative interventions piloted

comment.narrative: 1 no UNDP platforms available 2. no formal centre on innovation 3. 0 4. 0

1. Partnership with Royal Thai Government 2. Support launch of 10 Accelerator Labs 3. Produce CO innovation and acceleration roadmaps 4. Develop strategic experiments portfolio (e.g. NextGenGov India, future of work) 5. Organize ASEAN-China-UNDP Symposium on inclusive innovation 6. Develop a regional project on plastic waste management and circular economy using systemic design approach

1. Supported UNDP Thailand in negotiations for a partnership with the Royal Thai government, leading to a cost sharing agreement that has been submitted to Parliament for inclusion in the national budget (decision pending). Delivered 3 training sessions for Thai government counterparts.
2. Supported the establishment of UNDP Accelerator Labs in Asia-Pacific region (conducted interviews for new recruits, delivered training sessions, helped define work plans and priorities). Facilitated the creation of a community of practice: monthly calls for the innovation community, curating the RBAP innovation mailing list, conducting monthly webinars with external speakers.
3. Developed a Portfolio Sensemaking Protocol to accelerate the effects of portfolio of development projects. Conducted Portfolio Sensemaking workshops at 11 Asia-Pacific country offices, with 2 offices (Philippines and Indonesia) taking the decision to internalize the process. Developed a knowledge base on sensemaking in Teams and delivered training to CO colleagues to start build a network of practitioners. Helped other regions (RBEC, RBLAC, RBA) in the adoption of the portfolio in 13 countries.
4. Initiated NextGen Governance to design policy experiment with governments in the Asia-Pacific region.
5. Joint-organized and supported ASEAN-China-UNDP Symposium on Innovation in Achieving the SDGs and Eradicating Poverty in Hanoi, Viet Nam, 4-5 September 2019. Produced a report on Inclusive Innovation in Asia-Pacific and supported UNDP Viet Nam to initiate a policy dialogue on inclusive innovation with government counterparts.
6. Launched partnership with Alberta CoLab to work on plastic pollution and circular economy in 4 countries in the region (Maldives, Viet Nam, Sri Lanka, the Philippines) using systemic design approach. Delivered training program on system change for COs in Sri Lanka.

1. Maintain and upgrade the portfolio sensemaking protocol, grow the community of practitioners 2. Support country offices in developing portfolio composition and design competencies that support big pivots NextGenGov and systemic design (Mongolia, the Philippines, Bhutan) 3. Explore opportunities for system finance (Viet Nam, the Philippines)

1.1. Portfolio Sensemaking: - An in-person Portfolio Sensemaking session with UNDP Timor-Leste as CPD development support and way to accelerate learnings and synergies between existing projects on the ground. - Portfolio sensemaking protocol for remote virtual delivery was developed for deployment in 2021.
1.2. Onboarding of the second cohort of eight new Accelerator Labs (A-Labs) in Asia-Pacific: This included engagement with all pre-existing A-Labs, designing customized onboarding plan, Country Office (CO) identification of a frontier challenge, facilitation of a multi-week systems thinking based workshop series, and preparing a more developed foundation and runway for the incoming team.
2.1. NextGenGov initiative: a collaborative ‘learning by doing’ journey of senior policymakers across Asia. - the Regional Innovation Centre (RIC) organized one launch summit and four dialogues participated by government officials and partners in the region and beyond. The online events covered topics on governing in long emergencies caused by COVID-19 pandemic, recovery from the impacts of the pandemic, women in government innovations, digital transformations, and citizen participation and trust, technology platforms.
- The initiative led to new partnerships between UNDP Country Offices and governments i.e. India and the Philippines in Anticipatory Governance for Food Security; and Indonesia in Digital Transformation Roadmap and Execution.
- With NextGenGov’s pitch on Data-Driven Policymaking, RIC achieved its first funding partnership with The Rockefeller Foundation and received US$450,000 for 2020-2021 (18 months).
2.2. Systemic Design: RIC provided methods, toolkits and capacity building (ethnographic research, systems thinking, portfolio design and experimentation) to support Country Offices (COs) to apply systems approach and portfolio logic to unpack the complexity of the challenge and design solutions. - One regional initiative implemented in the Philippines and Indonesia to strengthen cities’ capacity on waste management by mobilizing fund from Government of Korea.
- Five project proposals developed as a continuation of the above initiative in the Philippines, Indonesia and Viet Nam and submitted to multiple donors such as Government of Korea, Japan and ASEAN Secretariat.
Maldives: Identified an initial waste segregation portfolio through the systemic design stakeholder engagement. The portfolio is being translated into a series of experiments that is further supported by additional funding from BRH NCE.
Pakistan: Designed a portfolio of experiments across key areas in the system of waste management.
The Philippines: - CO was able to start its journey with the ethnographic research. - CO will offer circular economy initiative as a part of its service offering for the mayor’s office in the Pasig city. - RIC contributed to the set-up of the Pintig Lab by providing technical support with data analytics, design for data driven policy research related to socioeconomic response and recovery strategies, and advice on the design. The Lab has been endeavoring to support government partners on COVID-19 response and recovery through data driven policymaking and will be launched officially in early 2021.
Viet Nam: Designed two portfolios of interventions to Senhance the compliance and efficiency of waste segregation and collection, while build the transition towards circular economy which resulted in the launch of Circular Economy Lab with Da Nang Business Incubator.
3. System Finance: UNDP Viet Nam has started the work on system financing and received seed funding from Finland for program design but UNDP Philippines has not started yet.

1. Country digital maturity assessments and road maps and Cutting-edge offer (Indonesia, Lao PDR, Sri Lanka, Thailand). 2. Integrated service delivery digital cutting-edge product: Government as a platform (GAAP) and Social Innovation Platform (SIP) (Indonesia, Bangladesh). 3. Cutting-edge offer/product: government and cities response to climate change (Viet Nam, Philippines). 4. Build regional capacity, thought leadership (foresight and data). 5. Data for improved UNDP planning project (Philippines).

Progress as of August 2021:
1. Country digital maturity assessments and road maps and Cutting-edge offer (Indonesia, Lao PDR, Sri Lanka, Thailand). LAO • Finalization of the Scope/ToR & RFO in coordination with CO team, Procurement and Government Partner • Engagement of Consulting agency for DMA and Strategy / Roadmap for Digital Transformation • Initiated DMA activities in collaboration with Ministry of Technologies and Communication • Next step for the country are (i) identification of few quick-win pilot projects to be initiated by early 2022, and (ii) completion of Digital Maturity Assessment including Gap Analysis and initial set of recommendations by end of 2021. THAILAND • Technical Input to the CO team on planning / contracting GDS should be prepared by end of 2021 • Supported for Digital Diagnostic Study by GDS and CO team • Technical support to TP Lab team on virtual innovation platform • Supported to A Lab team on digital aspects • Immediate next step is to plan for the next phase of activities based on the digital diagnostic report in coordination with CO team, OPDC and UK Embassy. SRI LANKA • Support provided to Citra Lab for Strengthening CIO Network by ICTA • Technical input to Digital Maturity Assessment and other digital initiatives by CO / Citra Lab INDONESIA • Supporting CO on framing the scope and signing MoU with Kominfo • Drafting ToR / Scope of work for engagement of consulting agency for digital Maturity Assessment • Next steps: (i) Finalization of the ToR in coordination with CO and Kominfo (ii) Preparation of RFO and bid process management in coordination with CO / procurement team (iii) Engagement of Consulting agency and initiation of DMA.
2. Integrated service delivery digital cutting-edge product: Government as a platform (GAAP) and Social Innovation Platform (SIP) (Indonesia, Bangladesh). This is no longer part of the RIC workplan and will not be delivered.
3. Cutting-edge offer/product: government and cities response to climate change (Viet Nam, Philippines). • Systemic design engagement conducted in both Viet Nam and the Philippines; • Portfolio of experiments designed and tested in Da Nang, Vietnam resulting in establishment of the Circular Economy Hub and launch of the Challenge program as well as City engagement on the CE roadmap design for Da Nang; • Portfolio is being designed in Pasig City, PHL (expected to be finalized and validated with the City in early September 2021). • Regional framing for CE offer drafted and being further codified (finalization expected in October 2021).
4. Build regional capacity, thought leadership (foresight and data). RIC has developed the sensemaking protocol to be able to be used by Country Offices with less facilitation by RIC. We are adding a foresight component. Work under this component is expected to be completed and launched soon.
5. Data for improved UNDP planning project (Philippines). • With RIC’s support, Pintig Lab of UNDP Philippines is conducting a data-driven experiment that analyzes various attitudes towards covid-19 vaccines among the population segments and generate actionable intelligence to help Department of Health (DoH) to design communication messages for curbing the vaccine hesitancy. The initial results are captured in a report. UNDP will continue the collaboration with DoH, WHO, and UNICEF in the next phase. RIC has allocated $35,000 for this experiment. As for the next steps, RIC will support Pintig Lab to leverage the insights from the preliminary analysis to design communication messages/strategies with DOH that can nudge people’s attitudes and behaviors based on the different personas. The experiment will also evaluate the effectiveness of these interventions.
• Pintig Lab is also conducting another data-driven experiment on providing support of anticipatory governance for Local Governance Units (LGUs). UNDP is providing the FASSSTER platform (the data dashboard) for a few selective LGUs to monitor the covid-19 related health situations and anticipate the emerging risks with data visualization. UNDP is also supporting the LGUs to interpret the results from the dashboard and generate recommendations. RIC has allocated $50,000 for this experiment. As end of 2021 target, RIC will provide advice to Pintig Lab on refining the functions of the platform based on the feedback from the LGUs. RIC will support Pintig to strengthen its service on using data for decision-making.
• Pintig Lab is also conducting another data-driven experiment on providing support of anticipatory governance for Local Governance Units (LGUs). UNDP is providing the FASSSTER platform (the data dashboard) for a few selective LGUs to monitor the covid-19 related health situations and anticipate the emerging risks with data visualization. UNDP is also supporting the LGUs to interpret the results from the dashboard and generate recommendations. RIC has allocated $50,000 for this experiment.
• RIC is working with UNDP Philippines on the data-driven portfolio analytics for the CO’s strategic development that uses project-related data from UNDP’s corporate system and project documents to understand the portfolio structure and distribution in the CO. Through visualizing the patterns and connections between projects, the work aims to identify insights for enhancing portfolio coherence and breaking the silos. The prototype of the data dashboard that looks like the global portfolio and the Philippines portfolio is completed. With regard to the Portfolio analytics for strategic insights, RIC will complete the final dashboard with the feedback gathered from the Technical Working Group in the CO, capture the key insights of the analysis in a report and share the learning along the journey in a blog.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Progress as of November 2021:
1. Country digital maturity assessments and road maps and Cutting-edge offer (Indonesia, Lao PDR, Sri Lanka, Thailand).
LAO • Completion of deep dive interviews with Key Ministries, Provinces, Potential donors and UN agencies, CSOs and other key stakeholders. • Completion of Digital Maturity Assessment including Gap Analysis and initial set of recommendations by Dec 2021 / Jan, 2022 • Identification of few quick-win pilot projects to be initiated by early 2022
THAILAND • Plan for the next phase of activities based on the digital diagnostic report and exploration of the opportunities for digital procurement market place for Thai Govt in coordination with CO team, OPDC and UK Embassy.
SRI LANKA • Finalization of the Digital Maturity Assessment report • Supporting CO / Citra Lab on the ongoing / new digital initiatives • Onboard consultants for digital training modules for public service.
INDONESIA • Publication of RFO to the LTA holders • Finalization of Consulting agency for DMA
2. Integrated service delivery digital cutting-edge product: Government as a platform (GAAP) and Social Innovation Platform (SIP) (Indonesia, Bangladesh). • Adoption of strategy and identified themes for RIC’s work for 2022 based on available resources and demand from COs. Developing a new model for maturity assessment and service testing based around lenses such as gender. • Onboarding digital consultants for training modules for civil servants
3. Cutting-edge offer/product: government and cities response to climate change (Viet Nam, Philippines).
• Portfolio design for Pasig City, PHL to be finalized and validated with the City • Proposal for AEPW partnership with the circular economy offering to be drafted • The service offer is expected to be finalized in December 2021. • The application protocol of systemic design to be launched in December 2021 • The concept note for circular city to be finalized in December 2021
4. Build regional capacity, thought leadership (foresight and data). • Work completed and launched.
5. Data for improved UNDP planning project (Philippines).
• Vaccine hesitancy: RIC will support Pintig Lab to leverage the insights from the preliminary analysis to design communication messages/strategies with DOH that can nudge people’s attitudes and behaviors based on the different personas. The experiment will also evaluate the effectiveness of these interventions. • Anticipatory governance for LGUs: RIC will provide advice to Pintig Lab on refining the functions of the platform based on the feedback from the LGUs. RIC will support Pintig to strengthen its service on using data for decision-making. • Portfolio analytics for strategic insights: RIC will capture the key insights of the analysis in a report and share the learning along the journey in a blog.
